intro: Agalmyla bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, contrasting leaf colors, typically green on one side and silver or white on the other. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. Agalmyla bicolor is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and attractive blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
